intro: Morilandia pulchella, commonly known as the beautiful morilandia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. The leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
